page.title: 08Mark's Story
page.content: It was a hot and sticky day and down below you could see several white dots on the village green. The bowler walked back shining the ball, the silver studs on hie boots glinting in the sun as he marked out his run. The captain started to place his field. A man in shorts and t-shirt watched with great excitement as the bowler started his run up. The batsman began tapping his bat on his boots. As the bowler's arm came over he saw the stitches on the ball and the stain of red on his trousers where he had been rubbing it on his leg. A small child stopped to watch for a minute and then carried on with his game. The batsman lifted his bat. As the ball bounced dust was scattered scattered. There was the satisfying crack of leather against willow and the ball sailed high into the air.....
